name: Snipping
tagline: Edit and run python snippet in real time
body:
# Usage

Just run Snipping like this,

```
$ snipping
```

Also you can specify the snippet filename.

If the file exists, Snipping will read the content, and save to the file when you `Save`,
if not, Snipping will start from empty snippet, and save to the file on command.

```
$ snipping [path/to/snippet]
```

# Special thanks

* [prompt_toolkit](http://github.com/jonathanslenders/python-prompt-toolkit) for the terminal interface.

# Notice

In `snipping`, `sys.stdout` and `sys.stderr` is redirected to a `stringIO`, so actions related to them may be different from the original Python.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
